frontmatter.title: VICE
frontmatter.dek: I spent my time at VICE leading design on their homegrown editorial platform, an owned and operated video platform, a suite of native apps, and even a digital rebrand. It’s a long case study.

frontmatter.title: Karma
frontmatter.dek: Karma’s goal was to deliver simpler, friendlier internet to everyone. Our small team branded the device, designed its marketing, and built both web and app-based tools to manage your data.

frontmatter.title: Cover
frontmatter.dek: Cover was a tool that helped restaurant owners and diners focus on food - not the check. Our app split payments at the table, simplified tipping, and sent the transaction to the back of the house.

frontmatter.title: Etsy
frontmatter.dek: You know Etsy. I led design on an effort to make seller tools more cohesive while introducing a company-wide component-based design system.

frontmatter.title: On Relearning to Code
frontmatter.dek: How I finally learned (some) React for the relaunch of my website.

frontmatter.title: Waiting
frontmatter.dek: Because we should all have a pandemic time capsule to look back on.

frontmatter.title: Hope For Good Blogs
frontmatter.dek: Lazy ads have wrecked user experience on media websites. These two launches give me hope for a turnaround.

frontmatter.title: Why I Care About Digital Media
frontmatter.dek: Last week’s layoffs were another punch to a community more fragile than it should be.
